meanings.definition: To spread or daub (a substance) thinly over a surface.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys smearing paint on her canvas.
meanings.sent2: The child was smearing peanut butter on the bread.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was caught smearing mud on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush danced across the canvas, smearing colors together.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly demonstrated smearing icing on the cake.

meanings.definition: To damage the reputation of (someone) by false accusations; slander.
meanings.sent1: He was caught smearing lies about his coworker.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid was smearing celebrities with baseless rumors.
meanings.sent3: The gossiping parrot was smearing the reputation of the zookeeper.
meanings.sent4: The rival company tried smearing our brand with negative reviews.
meanings.sent5: The politician resorted to smearing his opponent during the debate.

meanings.definition: The act of spreading a substance thinly over a surface.
meanings.sent1: The smearing of butter on the toast was done with care.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the smearing of ink on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The accidental smearing of sauce on his shirt made him laugh.
meanings.sent4: The gentle smearing of lotion on her skin felt soothing.
meanings.sent5: The messy smearing of glue on the project caused a sticky situation.
